title: ID: Crafty looking font from a website
content:
Hi,

I need some help identifying a font from a website.

The font I need to identify is in the website header:

[http://anchorbmx.com.au/home/templates/anchorbmx/images/header.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203225151/http:/anchorbmx.com.au/home/templates/anchorbmx/images/header.gif "http://anchorbmx.com.au/home/templates/anchorbmx/images/header.gif")

I’ve also attached a sample.

Thanks for your help! :)

 [‹ Alternative for Parisine](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203225151/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41408 "Go to previous forum topic") [Identify this font please ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203225151/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41424 "Go to next forum topic")
author: blahblahwoofwoo

comments.content:
One of the things I’ll regret for the rest of my life is that I didn’t go there when I had the chance (being in NYC) before it was closed.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203225151im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/GB-HANGING-OUTSIDE_4786.jpg)

By the way, that’s the Ramones hanging out there.  
Does anyone know what OMFUG stands for?

Thank you! :)

(Wikipedia says: ’The full name is CBGB & OMFUG which stands for “Country Bluegrass Blues and Other Music For Uplifting Gormandizers”. Gormandizer usually means a ravenous eater of food, but according to Kristal here it means “a voracious eater of ... music”.’)

I always thought the name was funny because I never saw any country or bluegrass music there, usually punk, ska, rockabilly, something much harder and edgier.

I’ll never forget the bathrooms.
